subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Martin Luther's 95 Theses
description: A quick, practical guide to Martin Luther's 95 Theses.

hook.text: A monk with a hammer, 95 complaints, and a church door. October 31, 1517 changed Christianity permanently.

buildup.text: Luther was outraged that the Church sold indulgences â€” pay money, skip purgatory. He called it corruption.

discovery.text: His 95 Theses argued salvation comes through faith, not works or payments. The printing press made them viral.

twist.text: Luther didn't want to leave the Church. He wanted to fix it. The split was accidental â€” and irreversible.

climax.text: The Reformation broke Catholic unity and launched centuries of religious war. One protest changed the world.

punchline.text: Luther wanted reform. He got revolution. One protest split the world.

quiz.question: What did Martin Luther protest against?
